Role Definition: Define, implement, track and assess the new business development plans for the enterprise or specific business divisions. This can cover business activities such as new market segment entry, product coverage and product specification development, brand development, new customer acquisition and existing customer, cross-sell/up-sell and retention.
Example of Use: Corporate strategy develops targets for new business acquisition in selected market segments
Executive Summary: Define, implement, track and assess the new business development plans
Key Features: Track progress towards goals and direct activity

Role Definition: Plan, and assess sales activity and re-direct resources and priorities as necessary
Example of Use: Sales management review quarterly performance and pipeline and set sales targets and allocations for the upcoming cycle
Executive Summary: Plan, and assess sales activity and re-direct resources and priorities as necessary
